rally around: When people rally around someone or something, they unite or assemble in support of someone or something.
deviate from: To deviate from something means to start doing something different or not planned, especially in a way that causes problems for others.
be foreign to: Something that is foreign to a particular person or thing is not typical of them or is unknown to them.
serve to: If one thing serves to do something, it is to be of use for that thing.
conspicuous consumption: Conspicuous consumption means spending your money in such a way that other people can see how wealthy you are.
give over to: An object given over to a cause means it is used for a particular purpose.
be tempted to: If you say that you are tempted to do something, you mean that you would like to do it.
